image.altText: A man cries as another puts their arms around him.

props.synopsis: As the resort town of Crans-Montana reels from the news of a tragic fire at a New Year's Eve party, a witness recalls hearing screams and seeing people covered in blood in the aftermath of the bar blaze.

title.children: Ski resort fire witnesses recall how tragic Crans-Montana blaze unfolded

image.altText: An extreme close up of Donald Trump with his eyes closed and a grimacing expression

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says he regrets undergoing advanced imagery on his heart and abdomen because of the "ammunition" it handed his critics, but has once more defended his "perfect" health.

title.children: Trump says health scan gave critics 'ammunition', blames bruising on aspirin

image.altText: An illustration showing smog from Chinese factories juxtaposed with a bushfire in Australia.

props.synopsis: As China caps off a historic clean-up of its smog and air pollution, the clearer air is helping temperatures rise to new records. Now, researchers are linking that change to hotter and drier conditions in Australia.

title.children: China's anti-pollution crusade linked to Australian bushfires

image.altText: Australia cricketer Usman Khawaja touches his face with his finger during his retirement press conference.

props.synopsis: Australia batter Usman Khawaja announces he will retire from international cricket after the fifth and final Ashes Test at the SCG, which starts on Sunday.

title.children: Khawaja hits out at 'racial steroetypes' as he announces Test retirement

image.altText: Australian Test batter Usman Khawaja looks to the sky as he walks off after losing his wicket.

props.synopsis: Before his debut in 2011, Australia had never seen a cricketer like Usman Khawaja and, thanks to his work on and off the field, he'll be followed by plenty more.

title.children: Khawaja's on-field brilliance pales in comparison to his true impact

image.altText: Xi Jinping in a navy suit and red tie clapping his hands and smiling slightly

props.synopsis: Beijing's new measures are aimed at trying to rein in an Australian surge and manage local growth, rather than a direct target on Australia.

title.children: China's beef tariffs aren't about Australia

image.altText: An elevated shot of tightly packed black-roofed houses stretching into the distance.

props.synopsis: The red-hot Australian housing market is showing the first signs of easing since interest rates started rising in May 2022.

title.children: Not a 'blip': Sydney and Melbourne property prices go into reverse

image.altText: Waves crashing on rocks at Coogee Beach.

props.synopsis: The identity of one of three people who died in a cluster of drownings on the New South Wales coast in recent days has been confirmed as a Sydney hairdresser and mother.

title.children: 'Everybody knows her': Sydney mother one of three drowning victims

image.altText: Four Easter Island Moai silhouettes in single file line on a platform in front of an orange setting sun and glowing clouds.

props.synopsis: A study using 11,600 aerial drone photos to map a mountainous quarry in 3D reveals more about how the island's famed stone sentinels were created and moved to their final resting places.

title.children: Easter Island researchers say giant statues 'walked' into position

image.altText: A man in a Brisbane Lions guernsey kicking a football

props.synopsis: The club said the 32-year-old had made the decision following a "challenging personal period".

title.children: Lachie Neale apologises for actions that led to marriage breakdown

image.altText: A woman with short dark hair and glasses in a floral top.

props.synopsis: The Clark MP says she knows the decision "will be disappointing for some," but it is necessary for her to be "effective" in parliament — a move that has "blindsided" her former colleagues.

title.children: Greens member 'blindsides' Tasmanian party by quitting

image.altText: Bernie Sanders, Rama Duwaji and Zohran Mamdani stand on a stage in front of City Hall.

props.synopsis: New York's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, has vowed not to water down his ambitious agenda during an impassioned inauguration address outside City Hall. But is his vision achievable?

title.children: Bernie Sanders swears in Zohran Mamdani with a word of warning

image.altText: A menorah stands amount candles, flowers and an Australian flag at a memorial to the victims of the Bondi terror attack.

props.synopsis: Former Reserve Bank governors and CEOs are among more than 130 business leaders and prominent Australians calling for a Commonwealth royal commission in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack.

title.children: Nation's biggest employer groups now support royal commission into Bondi attack

image.altText: Aerial view of protesters marching down a major road in downtown Tehran.

props.synopsis: Protests spread from the capital Tehran to other cities and across demographics, with people demanding Iran's leaders end the country's clerical rule and hold free elections.

title.children: 'A hunger revolution': Inside the massive protests sweeping Iran

image.altText: A seal with its mouth open.

props.synopsis: As we start the new year, take some time out to explore some of the other stories you might have missed this holiday period.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Ravenous ladybirds, a grumpy seal and a unique home

image.altText: Venus Williams with teased pink hair grimaces as she hits a tennis ball.

props.synopsis: Venus Williams will play in the main draw of the Australian Open for the first time since 2021, 28 years after she first graced Melbourne Park.

title.children: Williams to set new Australian Open record at 45 after receiving wildcard

image.altText: Four men start paddling on a boat made of cans in water at the beach

props.synopsis: From pint-sized penny farthings to tuna tosses, a beer can regatta to the Running of the Sheep, there's a regional festival for everyone's interests.

title.children: Add these must-do regional festivals to your 2026 calendar

image.altText: Lightning strikes

props.synopsis: Queensland's Darling Downs has recorded more severe storm warning days than any other region this season — and meteorologists say it is no coincidence.

title.children: Why severe storms keep forming over Queensland's Darling Downs

image.altText: runway feeling off in huge chunks revealing dirt underneath as three men observe

props.synopsis: Rain has hit saturation point in parts of northern Queensland as communities remain isolated and cattle are lost.

title.children: Roads, rail, runways impacted as outback flooding continues

image.altText: Damaged red SUV on grass, bricks on the ground

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old man has been remanded in custody after allegedly going on a multi-day crime spree across Victoria's south-east involving carjackings, burglaries and a police pursuit.

title.children: Man accused of wild rampage across Latrobe Valley appears in court

image.altText: a woman in a hospital bed holding hands with another person

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government says it will introduce Voluntary Assisted Dying legislation to parliament this year, nearly two decades after the Commonwealth vetoed the NT’s world-first euthanasia legislation in 1997.

title.children: NT to introduce Voluntary Assisted Dying bill mid-2026

image.altText: Graffitied roller doors on Victoria Street.

props.synopsis: Richmond's Victoria Street, once a buzzing area home to dozens of restaurants and grocers, has seen better days. What can be done to bring it back to its bustling best?

title.children: This Melbourne suburb has been on the decline, but a new future beckons

image.altText: Three uniformed police officers walking on a road blocked off with orange cones.

props.synopsis: In just four minutes, two men were stabbed in the chest and customers inside the Queanbeyan hair salon were left shaken.

title.children: Bikies allegedly sat waiting in hair salon before stabbing two men

image.altText: Metal railing at entrance to Tennant Creek Police Station with 11 bunches of various flowers tied to the railing.

props.synopsis: A remote outback town is searching for answers about why a “respectful, friendly and bubbly” Aboriginal mother died in the police watch house, more than 24 hours after her Christmas Day arrest.

title.children: Friendly, bubbly Aboriginal mother mourned after death in custody

image.altText: A person tattooing an arm.

props.synopsis: While most people worry about the pain of tattooing, studies suggest that being inked — and removing ink if you change your mind — may increase the chance of health issues down the track.

title.children: Getting inked may carry more risks than Mum's disapproval

image.altText: Pamela Misius in the kitchen of her home with her son-in-law and three grandchildren.

props.synopsis: The days when councils decide if a second home or a granny flat are built on NSW's largest properties could be numbered.

title.children: This crowded house sits on a huge property, but a second home is not allowed

image.altText: A large silver truck drives off into a pink sunset.

props.synopsis: Australia's road transport industry is facing a growing driver shortage driven by an aging workforce and limited recruitment of younger people.

title.children: Truck driver shortage puts squeeze on Australia's supply chain

image.altText: Grey nurse shark captured with underwater camera.

props.synopsis: The Sea World Foundation teams up with divers to locate, catch and release tangled grey nurse sharks — often referred to as the "labradors of the sea", despite their toothy appearance.

title.children: Divers help free critically endangered grey nurse sharks from fishing gear

image.altText: Whales surfacing while humans watch.

props.synopsis: People normally try to avoid getting mugged, but when it comes to being mugged by humpback whales, sightseers are travelling to Queensland's whale-watching capital to witness this special event.

title.children: People are lining up to witness a whale 'mugging' but what is it?

image.altText: Australia cricketer Adam Gilchrist hugs teammate Damien Martyn from behind at training. Both are wearing caps and sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Adam Gilchrist says there are "positive signs" from recent tests on former state and national teammate Damien Martyn, who is in hospital due to meningitis.

title.children: Gilchrist says 'encouraging signs' as Damien Martyn treated for meningitis

image.altText: Two MPs side by side in a composite image

props.synopsis: The lower house of South Australia's parliament has two representatives from the Limestone Coast. Both are now in custody.

title.children: The bizarre political-legal drama unfolding in SA’s South East

image.altText: Wayne Green wearing a blue shirt stands in front of a vehicle.

props.synopsis: Authorities urge people to adhere to total fire ban warnings one year on from a man's "stupid, thoughtless, dumb act" to set alight a pile of leaves and leave it unattended.

title.children: Total fire ban compliance plea after blaze's devastating consequences

image.altText: A woman holding magnets in garden.

props.synopsis: The process of creating detailed self-portraits, inspired by tropical landscapes, helped Piiij Goodrem deal with past trauma and addiction.

title.children: How 'hyper detailed' self-portraits helped Piiij rediscover her body
